metadata.title: CVE-2022-23132 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - negligible
metadata.description:
During Zabbix installation from RPM, DAC_OVERRIDE SELinux capability is inuse to access PID files in [/var/run/zabbix] folder. In this case, ZabbixProxy or Server processes can bypass file read, write and executepermissions check on the file system level

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-agent2 - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-web-service - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:6.0.29+dfsg-1').
